Klasse Stack<T>

java.lang.Object
Stack<T>
Typparameter:
T - The type of elements stored in the stack.
public class Stack<T> extends Object
A generic Stack class that implements a stack data structure. It uses an array internally to store the elements and throws custom exceptions when trying to pop or peek from an empty stack, or push to a full stack.

    • Stack

      public Stack()
      Default constructor for Stack, initializing with a default capacity of 10.

    • Stack

      public Stack(int capacity)
      Constructor that accepts an initial capacity for the stack.
      Parameter:
      capacity - The maximum capacity of the stack.

  • Methodendetails

    • push

      public void push(T item) throws StackFullException
      Pushes a new element onto the stack.
      Parameter:
      item - The item to be pushed onto the stack.
      Löst aus:
      StackFullException - If the stack is already full.

    • pop

      public T pop() throws StackEmptyException
      Pops an element from the stack.
      Gibt zurück:
      The element removed from the stack.
      Löst aus:
      StackEmptyException - If the stack is empty.

    • peek

      public T peek() throws StackEmptyException
      Peeks at the top element of the stack without removing it.
      Gibt zurück:
      The top element of the stack.
      Löst aus:
      StackEmptyException - If the stack is empty.

    • list

      public String list()
      Lists all the elements in the stack as a string, with elements separated by ";".
      Gibt zurück:
      A string representation of the stack elements.
